div.l: These foure sparkles longith vnto eelde
Oure olde lymes mowe wel be vnwelde
But wille ne shal not failen that is soth
And ȝit haue I alwey a coltes toth
As many a ȝere as it is passed henne
Sith that my tappe of lyf bigan to renne
For sikirly whanne I was born anoon
Deth drough the tappe of lyf and leet it gon
And euere sithen hath so the tappe ronne
Tyl that almost al empty is the tonne
The streem of lyf now droppith on the chymbe
The sely tonge may wel rynge and chymbe
Of wrecchidnes that passid is ful ȝore
With old folk saue dotage is no more
Whanne that oure oost hadde herd this s̉ermonyng
He gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
He seide what amountith al this witt
What shal we speke al day of holy writt
The deuel made a Reue for to preche
Or of a Soutere shipman or a leche
Seye forth thi tale and tarie nouȝt the tyme
Lo depford and it is halfwey pryme
Lo Grenewich that many a shrewe is Inne
It were al tyme thi tale forto bigynne
Now sires qduod this Osewold the Reue
I pray ȝou alle the ȝe nouȝt ȝe ȝou greue
Though I answere and somdel sette his houwe
For leful it is with force · force of shouwe
This dronken meller hath told vs heere
How that bigiled was a Carpentere
ꝐParauenture in scorn for I am oon
And by ȝoure leue I shal hym quite anoon
Right in his cherlis termes wil I speke
I pᵃraie to god his necke mote to breke
He can wel in myn ye se a stalk
But in his owne he can nouȝt seen a balk
